search_results.snippet: One Hundred Years of Solitude (Spanish: Cien aos de soledad) is a landmark 1967 novel by Colombian author Gabriel Garca Mrquez that tells the multi-generational story of the Buenda family, whose patriarch, Jos Arcadio Buenda, founds the town of Macondo, the metaphoric Colombia.
